psf.operators module¶

OPERATOR CLASSES

This module contains classses for defining algorithm operators and gradients. Based on work by Yinghao Ge and Fred Ngole.

Author:Samuel Farrens <samuel.farrens@gmail.com>
Version:1.1
Date:04/01/2017
class psf.operators.GradBasic[source]¶

Basic gradient class

This class defines the basic methods that will be inherited by specific gradient classes

MtMX(x)[source]¶

M^T M X

This method calculates the action of the transpose of the matrix M on the action of the matrix M on the data X

Parameters:

x : np.ndarray

Input data array
Returns:

np.ndarray result

Notes

Calculates M^T (MX)

get_grad(x)[source]¶

Get the gradient step

This method calculates the gradient step from the input data

Parameters:

x : np.ndarray

Input data array
Returns:

np.ndarray gradient value

Notes

Calculates M^T (MX - Y)

class psf.operators.GradZero[source]¶

Bases: psf.operators.GradBasic

Zero gradient class

This is a dummy class that returns an array of zeroes for the gradient

get_grad(x)[source]¶

Get the gradient step

This method returns an array of zeroes

Parameters:

x : np.ndarray

Input data array
Returns:

np.zeros array size
class psf.operators.StandardPSF(data, psf, psf_type='fixed')[source]¶

Bases: psf.operators.GradBasic, psf.algorithms.PowerMethod

Standard PSF class

This class defines the operators for a fixed or object variant PSF

Parameters:

data : np.ndarray

Input data array, an array of 2D observed images (i.e. with noise)

psf : np.ndarray

PSF, a single 2D PSF or an array of 2D PSFs

psf_type : str {‘fixed’, ‘obj_var’}

PSF type (defualt is ‘fixed’)

Notes

The properties of GradBasic and PowerMethod are inherited in this class

MX(x)[source]¶

This method calculates the action of the matrix M on the data X, in this case the convolution of the the input data with the PSF

Parameters:

x : np.ndarray

Input data array, an array of recovered 2D images
Returns:

np.ndarray result
MtX(x)[source]¶

MX

This method calculates the action of the transpose of the matrix M on the data X, in this case the convolution of the the input data with the rotated PSF

Parameters:

x : np.ndarray

Input data array, an array of recovered 2D images
Returns:

np.ndarray result
class psf.operators.StandardPSFnoGrad(data, psf, psf_type='fixed')[source]¶

Bases: psf.operators.GradZero, psf.operators.StandardPSF

No gradient class

This is a dummy class that inherits GradZero and StandardPSF
